{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about the long-term assessment of glucose control. The relevant documents mention that glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) is the standard method for assessing long-term glycemic control. HbA1c reflects average glucose levels over the preceding 2-3 months. Therefore, the answer is D. Estimation of blood level of glycosylated hemoglobin.", "answer_choice": "D"}
